name: Inglaterra Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here from Friday Aug 21st to Sunday Aug 23rd 2009 for a long weekend. Having intially booked another hotel much further out but managed to get it changed in time before we arrived, we were delighted with the location of Hotel Inglaterra. For tourists who want to be centrally located, this hotel is ideal. It's only a few minutes from the top of the Ramblas at Catalunya Square which is one of the main tourist thoroughfares with a myriad of street performers and stalls selling anything from trinkets to small animals and birds. We arrived at the hotel extra early and were informed that we were being upgraded to a deluxe room. To be honest, I think the only difference between that and a superior room was access to a private outside patio-type area. The room was lovely, nice big bathroom and all the usual amenities. Good choice of breakfasts in the morning. Room was made up every day when we were out. When back late, we didn't haave to ring a bell to get, there's someone on the front desk 24/7. When leaving on the Monday morning, we were able to store our luggage until that evening as we had a late flight back to Dublin.
reviews.title: Great location, very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the location was great - we could come back to the hotel if necessary to drop off stuff etc. Also, very close to the tour buses and metro station at Catalunya Square.
reviews.title: Good value * Good location * Good holiday *

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: 24-28th August 2009.-The Hotel is well situated in being just far enough away from the hustle & bustle of the “Las Ramblas”, yet close enough to walk to.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were pleasant and spoke good English. The room albeit quite small, was clean and adequate; the sheets and towels were changed every day of our 4 day stay. The room comprised of a desk TV small cupboad, Mini bar, there were doors openig onto a tiny area with 2 chairs and small table but was in an inner corridor with little natural light. We did ask for an upgrade but were told the hotel was fully booked. The air con was quiet and most welcoming. The Breakfast buffet dining area was nicely decorated and the food was good with a very good selection of hot & cold food and attentive staff.
reviews.title: Amazing Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would advise everyone who is not a lottery winner to give the bar a wide birth as a Vodka & Coke and a Whisky was 22Euros (a bottle of Jamesons was 13 euros in the corner shop). The biggest let down was the noise from the adjoining fast food restaurant, with furniture being dragged along the floor both late at night (10.30 pm) and very early morning (07.30 am).
reviews.title: Great location and comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a week in Barcelona. We stayed in a superior room because I had read the standards are small, and most negatives here are from those who stayed in the standards. The room was on the small side by US standards, but I would say average for European. We had a queen bed and thought it was comfortable. The mattress is on the firm side, but that's what I prefer. The bathroom was a decent size with tub. We had a small balcony opening onto the main street (Palei).
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location can't be beat. Walking distance to almost everywhere, and very near the Metro (and airport bus) stops at Placa Catalunya and Universitat. The staff was also very helpful, especially Maribel. We booked through the hotel website and breakfast was included. If it's not included it's probably not worth the 14E, but for us it was more than adequate.
reviews.title: Good location; average hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a great place to eat around the corner (exit right and make first right turn down the narrow street), called L'Oliva. It has the 3 lunch special for 12Euro (app, main, dessert and beverage). The food was very good and the portion large, especially the appetizer. The sandwich palce next door, Viena is also very good if you need a quick bite. Il Corte Ingles, near Catalunya, has a large grocery store section in the lower level where you can pick up snacks and beverages. There is a mini-fridge in the room stocked with the usual items, but we bought our own, and were able to fit water bottles in the fridge.
reviews.title: Too much money for what was delivered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved Barcelona, and this hotel was exactly what we hoped it would be.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Inglaterra was an average hotel with a great location. Because this was an anniversary trip, I decided to spring for one of the special "suites"--we stayed in the Dali suite on the sixth floor which had it's own private "terrace." I had to admit that I was not terribly impressed with the room...the size was only average and the terrace was absolutely nothing special. In fact, if you actually wanted a view, you literally had to stand on a chair to see over the "fence" that surrounded the terrace. The beds are HORRIBLY uncomfortable. All that said, the location is fantastic...just a short walk to La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya, Metro Stops and tour buses. If you stay, go for one of the classic rooms--they're small by American standards, but they are just fine if you need someplace to sleep. Also...the breakfast that is available downstairs is most certainly NOT worth the 15 euros that they charge...go down the street to McDonald's instead! All in all, an average hotel in a decent location.
reviews.title: Clean and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights. Very clean, great location, very quiet. Easy (less than 5 minute) walk from the Placa Universidad where the bus from the airport dropped us. Metro close by and only 5 minute walk from Las Rambla. I felt very safe in the area (2 women traveling). Tons of shopping on the block and not far from the more expensive Paseo de Gracia shops. Little cafe next door for breakfast (cafe and croissant for two was less than 5 euros). Good suggestions for tapas from the staff and a pretty roof deck which I could enjoy even in January. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: great hotel
workmen on scaffolding
reviews.text: we paid more money than we would normally pay as the hotel looked good, however there was no mention of the hotel being worked on .we were woken up very early by the noisey workmen ,and when i went to open the curtains i was faced with a spanish decorator on scaffolding looking in to my room, so i had to keep the curtains permanently closed making the room dark and miserable.we mentioned this to reception but there were no more rooms to be moved into, hence we checked out early and stayed in a better hotel on the main las ramblas which was much beter.

reviews.title: Super Service
reviews.text: We had a fantastic stay at Hotel Inglaterra. The rooms were clean, the service was outstanding and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was (210) not very big, the channels of the tv set where not all ok, could not watch the vuelta for instance .
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed when I first saw our room at the hotel - after about 15 hours traveling to get to Barcelona, I was in the mood for the spacious comfort of a 5 star hotel, not the little room with no view that greeted my eyes. But . . . the bed was comfortable, the shower terrific with great hot water supply, the air conditioner and heating was very effective, and the room was sparkling clean. Great towels, too. The staff spoke English and were very helpful, i.e., I needed a haircut and was directed to a nearby shop where I got a good haircut at a decent price. Breakfast was good with a nice variety of food. Room service was excellent. The location very central to all of the places we wanted to see in Barcelona, just off Ramblas with all of it's noise. I'd return in an instant.
reviews.title: Minor drawbacks, major pluses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only real carp is the huge step required to get out to our patio. In my exhausted state our first night, I forgot it was there and almost killed myself falling into the room. They should put a couple of steps there, or someone will be injured, quite seriously possibly.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is a great value because it is located very near the Ramblas and Catanalunya Plaza which is where the tour buses, metro and many big restaurants are. The street is very quiet at night and you cannot hear a thing. We had a quite large twin bed room (307), spotlessly clean which had a small balcony with doors to open and you can go outside. There is air conditioning control in the room. The bathroom is large with a bidet, stool, toilet, tub,and great shower, with plenty of room left to walk around. Breakfast is generous with eggs, fruit, cereal and very good french bread and cheese, as well as other things and served conveniently 7-11am.
reviews.title: Disappointed! iTouch stolen - No safe in room :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is excellent and very helpful with directions.
reviews.title: Poor customer service - No AC in Dali Room; No Windows in Gaudi Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel pre-cruise. The location is very good to the Ramblas and the market as well as other sites. The rooms are small and simple/modern but clean. We never could get the air conditioner to work properly so it's highly recommended to get an upper room with a balcony or patio. The split twin beds pushed together was a bit of a challenge when trying to sleep together as the beds would slide on the wood floor and seperate. The breakfast in the morning was hit or miss (disgusting cold and runny scrambled eggs one morning) but enough choices to at least have a meal to start the day. We found trying to find a nice place for dinner was a bit challenging in the area. Staff were nice but not overly friendly. Overall there are probably better choices in Barcelona but the rates are good and frankly we didn't stay in the room that much as there is too much to see and do in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Good location but so-so hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Inglaterra Hotel was brilliant. It is a stones throw away from Playa Catalunya. The staff were very friendly & helpful. I had a problem with the shower hose which was efficiently sorted. The room and bathroom was a lovely size, couldn't fault the cleaners, the air-conditioning worked very well. The buffet breakfast catered for everyone & was lovely, you could get room service or go to the restaurant all the meals were good that we had. We would definately go back there again. This hotel is value for money.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a stay at the Inglaterra at the end of June and stayed there for one week.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great buffet breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel couldn't be better. It is so close to everything you could want to see in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a double classic room and it was actually very big, in contrast to a lot of the reviews I had read. It was very clean, had everything in it we could need, including a minibar. The bathroom was also really clean and we had new towels everyday.
reviews.title: Might be a gamble, its true the aircon doesn't work, superb breakfast
perfect location
reviews.text: Just returned from three nights in the Hotel Inglaterra with our three grown-up children. We were very impressed with the modern rooms which all had up-to-date well-fitted en-suites. The staff were friendly and helpful and gave us good dining-out tips. The hotel is in the old town and within easy walking distance of most sights. I would thoroughly recommend to anyone on a short break to Barcelona.

reviews.title: Good Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Inglaterra for three nights in December. The location was great. Very central to many shops and restaurants and only a few minutes walk away from the main bus stops. The staff were very welcoming and helpful, they spoke and understood english very well. Our room was small but had everything we needed including a small balcony. It was very quiet during the evenings/night so we could get a good nights sleep. The only bad point to make was the breakfast (this was served between 7 and 11 am) some of the food had gone dry and hard(bread/cheese/ham) when left out and not covered up,and the fresh fruits(melon,fruit cocktail) going slightly brown again not covered up. Although the hot breakfast are well covered and very warm. Overall opinion we would definitely return and recommend to family and friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A group of 3 couples stayed at Inglaterra Hotel last days of october and we are extremly happy with our choise. The reception staff is very helpfull and friendly, they gave us rooms all togheter and they were all lovely, sunny, quiet and clean.
reviews.title: GREAT BOUTIQUE HOTEL, GREAT STAFF, GREAT CITY!!!!!

likes.liked: — location, the rooms, the staff... everything!!!!
likes.disliked: — walk around the gothic, you have many things to discover!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel situation is perfect for all the sightseens and near to great restaurants.
reviews.title: Great fluffy towels !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoy the time we spend in Barcelona and we will come back if we return to visit europe again.
reviews.title: Brilliant Place

likes.disliked: — No tea coffee but so what

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Yes the towels were very fluffy and the hotel was in a very nice situation. The breakfasts were good as it was self service and you could have most things. We had a superior room on the second floor, this was fine but there was rather a nasty smell in there and we thought it must have been the grubby stained carpet. Very sorry to have to say this as everything else was fine. I just felt I didnt really want to walk in the room without shoes on... I lived in Barcelona 25 years ago and went to the University there, the hotel was just a short walk away as it was from the centre of town... I hope all the rooms didnt have the problem ours did but I wouldn't stay there again... as the stale smell in the room made me feel a bit sick...
reviews.title: best accomodation in barcelona!

description: Boutique hotel entirely renovated and located in the centre of Barcelona, at the entrance of the famous Ramblas. It is next to Plaza Catalonia, MACBA Museum, Barrio Ghotico and prestigious Passeig de Gracia. It is the sister property of prestigious Hotel Majestic.
